column2: ENGLISH

column1: # Events that are in vanilla id range

# or new options for existing events

column2: The more the better! Welcome this little bastard in the tribe.
For a long time we Gospodars ruled here and we shed our blood with other people of these lands. The time has come to unite with them and create new great Kislev!
Let there be one nation, one people!
Gospodars, Ungols and other people of Kislev once divided are now creating family bonds and adopting new identity.
Excellent!
More and more people in Kislev are adopting new identity. Some of courtiers also embraced new ways.
Excellent!
Whole realm has adopted new Kislevarin. My servants inform me that it is increasingly popular to show new customs and speak new Kislevarin amongst Ungol and Gospodar Boyars and Szlachta...
Excellent!
My wise liege has persuaded me to adopt new customs and new identity - I am not Gospodar or Ungol now I've become Kislevite!
It was about time.
You send out invitations to your Pie Week jubilee.
You accept the invitation.
You decline the invitation.

Pie eating and revelry amongst family and friends is seen as the highest form of praise for the Halfling patron godess Esmerelda, the goddess of home and hearth. Every year, in celebration of the upcoming harvest, the Halflings of the moot celebrate Esmerelda's gifts by holding a week of celebrating and appreciating the simple joy of pie.
Send the invitations.
Invitations to the jubilee are sent.

You have been invited to join your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], at the Pie Week jubilee [From.GetSheHe] is hosting this year. The week-long celebration involves pie-eating contests, awards for the most delicious or most unique pie recipes, and general feasting and revelry.n\The holiday has understandably become one of the most widely celebrated aspects of Halfling culture and religious life outside The Moot.
How kind!
Unfortunately, I have other plans.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused your invitation to the Pie Week jubilee, claiming [From.GetSheHe] has other plans.
More for me, then!

The Jubilee has begun, with pies of every variety and filling occupying huge tables in the banquet hall. Songs of home and hearth are sung in thanks to Esmerelda while rivers of beer and mead flow from enormous casks in the banquet hall.
I hope I have enough room for seconds!

The jubilee of pies and drink lasts all day and night for the entire week, but all good things must end. Your vassals return home to digest, but most seem to agree that the pies and drink were worth the trip.
I'm stuffed!

The jubilee of pies and drink lasts all day and night for the entire week, but all good things must end. You must return home to digest, but you and most of the other guests seem to agree that the pies and drink were worth the trip.
Hosted Pie Week Jubilee
Refused to Join the Revelry
Host Pie Week

While Halflings aren't seen to be an especially religious people, their only holiday of note, Pie Week, is notable for its near-universal observance among the Halflings of the Moot. If you invite the best pie-makers froun around the moot and invite your vassals, this year's Pie Week jubilee will be one to be remembered!
The preparations for this year's Pie Week begin.

column1: # Changes to the localisation of vanilla events to add Warhammer flavor

column2: Tales of your misdeeds are told from Albion to Cathay.
Your low character is the subject of Tilean plays.
